definition: to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter

sentences.english: Melva kisses another guy in front of her boyfriend justifying it to herself as an eye for an eye.
sentences.chinese: 梅尔瓦在男友面前亲吻另一个男孩，自以为报复。

sentences.english: A dead body revenges not injuries.
sentences.chinese: 只有尸体才不会为受到的外伤而报复。

sentences.english: North Korea also prohibited reunions between North and South Korean families.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜作为报复停止了让朝鲜和韩国失散家庭团聚。

sentences.english: The German Emperor took revenge on China by making thinas difficult in the ceremony and propriety.
sentences.chinese: 出于报复心理，德皇在礼仪问题上刁难载沣使团。

sentences.english: Retaliation only escalates a bully's aggression.
sentences.chinese: 报复只会升高施霸凌者的侵犯气焰。

sentences.english: I seek no revenge on you, ' replied Heathcliff less vehemently. 'That's not the plan.
sentences.chinese: “我并不要对你报复，”希刺克厉夫回答，火气稍减。

sentences.english: You need not stay up at night seeking vengeance.
sentences.chinese: 你不需要熬夜去寻找报复的方法。

sentences.english: I also believe an attack on a us carrier with a strategic missle would lead to nuclear retaliation.
sentences.chinese: 我也相信用战略导弹攻击美国航母会导致核报复。

sentences.english: Ep667 - Kexin chooses Wenqiang as her boyfriend. Yingming is very angry. He vows to take revenge on both Sichuan and Wenqiang.
sentences.chinese: 可欣决定选择文强，英明即誓言向四川和文强报复。

sentences.english: Millions of money to anger, revenge Japanese mountain.
sentences.chinese: 钱百万怒不可遏，决意下山报复日军。
我的出轨不过是种报复。

sentences.english: It was that attack that finally sowed the seeds for Gaddafi's demise.
sentences.chinese: 正是这次报复事件为卡扎菲埋下了灭亡的种子。

sentences.english: Joe wanted to pay William off for backbiting him.
sentences.chinese: 乔尔因威廉在背后说他的坏话而要对他进行报复。

sentences.english: In fact, he wanted to strangle them, to get back at them.
sentences.chinese: 其实Richard是要报复他的同学，想掐死他们。

sentences.english: But you, O Lord , have mercy on me; raise me up, that I may repay them.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华阿，求你怜恤我，使我起来，好报复他们。

sentences.english: Indian jawans retaliated after mortars were fired from the Pakistani side.
sentences.chinese: 巴方发起迫击炮袭击后，印度士兵开始报复。

definition: to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
